use_cases_desc:
"target application is urban design charrettes (or simply charrettes), one common method for engaging the public in complex planning for urban design.
Charrettes are intensive multi-day processes during which a team of professionals and a diverse set of community stakeholders create a holistic development plan through a series of iterative feedback loops"
evaluation: Heuristic evaluation (criteria); User study (qualitative); Deployment with users
contribution_desc:
This application paper describes Urban Design Collaborative Spaces (UD Co-Spaces), a multi-display collabroative environment that supports urban design exercises of professionals and citizen without professional expertise. 
A tabletop display shows a 2D overview of an urban plan, a wall display a 3D view, while tablet devices can be used for configuration and individual work.
toolkits: SMART Table SDK; Microsoft Surface SDK; PQ labs multi-touch SDK
device_models: iPad; SMART Technology Digital Vision Touch (DViT) tabletop; Microsoft Surface; PQ Labs multi-touch surfaces
